content: What narrow strip of land, also the name of a famous canal, connects North and South America?

The narrow strip of land that connects North and South America is called the Isthmus of Panama. The famous canal located there is the Panama Canal, which is an artificial waterway that cuts through the isthmus, connecting the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans. The canal is one of the most significant international waterways in the world, facilitating global trade and transportation.
